qas.question: What does the Exchange specialize in?

answers.text: listing and trading of capital market instruments such as equities, debt issues, funds

qas.question: What is the BSX a member of?
Which foreign country offers the BSX Approved Stock Exchange Status?
What is the BXS a full member of?

context: There are four hundred securities listed <b4_0>on the stock exchange<b4_0/>, of which almost three hundred are offshore funds and alternative investment structures attracted by Bermuda's regulatory environment. The Exchange specialises in <a0_0>listing and trading of capital market instruments such as equities, debt issues, funds<a0_0/> (including hedge fund structures) and depository receipt programmes. The BSX is a full member of <a1_0>the <b5_0>World Federation of Exchanges<b5_0/><a1_0/> and is located in <a2_0>an <b6_0>OECD member nation<a2_0/>.<b6_0/> It also has Approved Stock Exchange status under <a3_0><b7_0>Australia<a3_0/>'s Foreign Investment Fund<b7_0/> (FIF) taxation rules and Designated Investment Exchange status by the UK's Financial Services Authority.
